intro: Solanum eburneum, commonly known as the white potato vine, is a flowering plant belonging to the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of white or pale purple flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers. Solanum eburneum is also used in some traditional medicinal practices, though its toxicity should be approached with caution.
